embeds.title: Chosen
embeds.description:
Common Skill / 1 :energy_collector: / Collectible / Downfall

Apply 2 (3) **Weak** :p_weak:.
If the enemy does not intend to attack, apply 3 (5) **Vulnerable** :p_vulnerable:.

messages.content: there are better weakness applicators
there are also better vulnerable applicators
why did people vote for this? it's a bit of a boring card
the other choices were fungi beast and split bruiser
split bruiser would've made you mald about the state of slime builds
and fungi beast is probably MORE boring
Bland card i dont normally collect
hey yknow what if all the collectibles were good the essence system would suck
no it would be good because there would be more choices to make 😈
I swear this used to be 3/3 (5/5)
but its presence was far too oppressive
Honestly that would make more sense
Shockwave sidegrade
this would be a better card if somebody other then collector had it
by the time you are in act 2, you already have several sources of weak and vurn in your base deck and have little need to add even more to your collection.

As is this case for many collectibles, this just comes a little too late in the run to be worth adding. By the time you reach act 2, you probably already have the ring of the serpent effect online, and you are very likely to have some very strong collected cards you want to draw quickly. 2 Weak for 1 energy is not a very strong rate, especially when it doesn't reliably do anything else. Collector also has several better tools for applying weak that don't take up valuable collected deck space. It might be worth it if you had several strong payoffs for affliction, but weren't very good at applying the conditions yet, but that's a very strange place to find yourself in, and even then, this doesn't apply the vulnerable on every turn. Gets a little better if you have somber shield to try and stall for a turn to land the vulnerable more often.
It's also worth noting that black bindings does the exact same thing but also does damage.
(in terms of weakness)

The only positive thing I can say about this is that if you have Champion’s Belt and Sadistic Nature (both of which are individually very unlikely already) and you are able to meet the card’s condition then you can get three proc
six if you also have that doom power
...and <inflict agony> can do that too

embeds.title: Inflict Agony
embeds.description:
Common Attack / 2 :energy_collector: / The Collector / Downfall

Deal 12 (18) damage.
If the enemy is not **Afflicted,** apply 2 **Weak** :p_weak: and **Vulnerable** :p_vulnerable:.

messages.content: chosen creates tempo issues so I suggest we make this card just stun the enemy
that would make it more in line with how Chosen affects the player
:drakeclapping:
Collector doesn’t have access to every enemy debuff yet so that would also be nice
<collector poison>

embeds.title: Reptomancer
embeds.description:
Uncommon Power / 1 :energy_collector: / Collectible / Downfall

Gain 6 (8) **Temp HP.**
**Torchhead** gains "Apply 3 (4) Poison :p_poison: to a random enemy."

messages.content: I suggest we don't. Stuns are just universally overpowered, and getting one in act 2 is too strong
Also <endgame>

embeds.title: Endgame
embeds.description:
Special Skill / 5 (4) :energy_collector: / Collectible / Downfall

Remove the enemy's Invincible buff and Stun them.
**Exhaust**.

messages.content:
idea:
"Add some number of Dazed to your hand. Apply Weak and Vulnerable equal to current Dazed in your hand."
Collector already had her phase of being incredibly overpowered
issue is, there is no way to gain dazed on collector other than from the enemy
would just turn into mild hand clog
well it would also be exhaust synergy
I wasn’t here for that
the more we avoid methods of draftable turn skip the better
chosen doesn't turnskip you unless you are an idiot
or desperate
not every card HAS to be a banger y'all

I don't think collected needs to get better access to stun in their card pool, they are plenty strong already. Hex is certainly the most unique part of the chosen, but there's no good way to translate putting that on enemies. Collectible cards will always have to compete with each other for space just due to how they are drawn (1 per turn, as opposed to 5 from the normal deck), and so some of them will inevitably be worse than others, and therefore much harder to draft.
power: "whenever you gain a status or curse, all enemies lose 1 strength" ?
that would give it some defensive measures
and be thematic
way too good IMO
well i'm not a fan of temporary strength reduction in there because it would be so not impactful
does collector have that many ways of creating statuses/curses during combat?
this isn't clad/herm
there are basically none
precisely
or
"whenever you draw an unplayable card, all enemies lose 1 strength this turn. shuffle 1 wound into your draw pile."
collector has a fair few unplayables
and it wouldn't be too excessive
Honestly I would probably take that if it costed 4(3) energy if it existed, infinite strength reduction is op. Also pretty sure that <ember> is a status.

embeds.title: Ember
embeds.description:
Special Skill / Colorless / Downfall

**Unplayable**.
**Retain**.
When **Exhaust**ed, gain 1 (2) **Strength** :p_strength:.

messages.content: nope nvm special skill
I think chosen is fine to not be the best, it's a normal act 2 enemy.
but is it infinite?
what means does collector have to generate infinite statuses/curses?
I said that assuming embers would work. I'd still say that's pretty strong at 2(1) cost
i mean i'd be okay with 4 cost if we also expanded it to include embers
wait does current Neow give any curses/statuses?
neow combat gives like 1 curse per turn
no please don't
the 3 heroes fight will be useless because the 4 curses are immediately added at the start of combat
She's been updated on the branch to not have the hero buffs instead she is a healing machine
so i'm cool with temporary strength reduc on draw
I just don't think it's very chosen like, nor is it a niche collector needs help in.
random mob collectables don’t need to be that strong
boss and elite collectables should at least be worth considering draft
